meanings.definition: The act of embedding or the state of being embedded.
meanings.sent1: The embedment of the gem in the necklace was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: The embedment of the key in the lock was smooth and effortless.
meanings.sent3: The embedment of the toy in the cake surprised everyone at the party.
meanings.sent4: The embedment of knowledge in young minds is crucial for their development.
meanings.sent5: The embedment of seeds in the soil marks the beginning of growth.

meanings.sent1: She found the embedment of a hidden message in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The embedment of the fossil in the rock was a rare discovery.
meanings.sent3: The embedment of a secret compartment in the desk was cleverly done.
meanings.sent4: The embedment of memories in our hearts lasts a lifetime.
meanings.sent5: The embedment of emotions in music can evoke powerful feelings.
